title: Single-page promo site for YouTube channel @rashmijoshi6703

requirements.summary: Build a responsive single-page landing experience with prominent CTA links to the YouTube channel.
acceptanceCriteria: Landing page renders without errors and is responsive across mobile/tablet/desktop.
The page includes a prominent primary CTA button linking to https://www.youtube.com/@rashmijoshi6703.
All external links are clearly styled as interactive, keyboard-focusable, and open in a new tab with safe rel attributes (noopener/noreferrer).

file_operations.description: Create the single-page layout implementing the primary YouTube channel CTA (https://www.youtube.com/@rashmijoshi6703) with accessible external-link behavior (target=_blank + rel=noopener noreferrer) and responsive structure. Use shadcn-ui components (e.g., Button/Card) to provide polished CTAs and interactive styling; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Create a small reusable ExternalLink component that standardizes safe external linking (noopener/noreferrer), keyboard focusability, and consistent hover/focus styles across the page. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Add baseline global styles to ensure links and focus rings are clearly visible and consistent, and to support responsive spacing/typography without default/plain styling.

requirements.summary: Add Hero, About, Featured content card grid, and Contact/Links sections with in-page anchor navigation and editable link data.
acceptanceCriteria: Sections are present and navigable via in-page anchor links (e.g., #about, #featured, #links).
Featured content is represented as a list of cards that link out (URLs stored in a simple editable data structure in the frontend).
All links are clickable, visually consistent, and have hover/focus states.

file_operations.description: Create a simple editable frontend data structure containing featured video/playlist links and additional contact/links to render on the page (no YouTube API integration).

Create a Featured content section component that renders a responsive grid of link cards from the editable data structure. Use shadcn-ui Card (and related primitives) to provide consistent card layout and interaction states; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Create a header that includes in-page anchor navigation items for #about, #featured, and #links and works for both desktop and mobile. Use shadcn-ui navigation-related components (e.g., DropdownMenu/Sheet if available) for an accessible mobile menu; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Wire the Hero, About, FeaturedGrid, and Contact/Links sections into the single page with correct section ids (#about, #featured, #links) and ensure all section links use the shared ExternalLink styling/behavior. Use shadcn-ui layout primitives where appropriate for consistent spacing; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Implement a warm, creative, non-blue/purple visual theme applied consistently across the entire page.
acceptanceCriteria: Theme is consistent across all sections (colors, type scale, button styles, card styles).
Page looks polished: aligned layout grid, consistent spacing, and clear hierarchy.

file_operations.description: Define a cohesive warm sunset-inspired theme using CSS variables compatible with shadcn-ui/Tailwind (e.g., warm neutrals, coral/orange accents) and apply consistent typography scale, spacing, background treatments, and focus styles across the app (avoid primarily blue/purple).
Extend Tailwind theme (as needed) to support the creative warm palette and consistent typography/spacing utilities used throughout the page (ensuring the theme is not primarily blue/purple).

Apply the theme consistently across hero, cards, buttons, and section backgrounds using the shared design tokens and shadcn-ui components for uniform styling; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Add basic on-page SEO/shareability enhancements (title, meta description, and English hero copy).
acceptanceCriteria: Document title includes the channel handle/name and indicates it is an official channel site.
Meta description is present and written in English.
Hero heading/subheading are present in English and clearly describe the channel.

file_operations.description: Update the document title to include @rashmijoshi6703 and indicate it is an official channel site; add an English meta description suitable for sharing/SEO.
Ensure the hero headline/subheadline are present in English and clearly describe the channel, aligning with the updated title/meta description.

requirements.summary: Add a sticky/easily accessible header navigation with a persistent Subscribe CTA linking to the YouTube channel.
acceptanceCriteria: Header navigation links scroll to the correct sections.
Subscribe CTA is present and usable on both desktop and mobile.
All navigation and CTAs are accessible via keyboard (tab/enter/space).

file_operations.description: Implement sticky/easily accessible header behavior with in-page anchor links and a persistent Subscribe CTA linking to https://www.youtube.com/@rashmijoshi6703, ensuring full keyboard accessibility and clear focus states. Use shadcn-ui Button (and mobile menu primitives if used) for accessible interactions; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Wire the SiteHeader into the page layout and ensure anchor navigation scrolls to the correct section ids (#about, #featured, #links) without breaking responsiveness.

requirements.summary: Add and render generated static image assets from frontend/public/assets/generated with proper layout stability and alt text.
acceptanceCriteria: Generated images exist under frontend/public/assets/generated and are referenced by the UI.
Hero/banner image is visible in the hero section without layout shift.
Images include appropriate alt text in English.

file_operations.description: Add the generated wide hero banner background image asset (static file) at this exact path for use in the hero section.
Add the generated circular avatar placeholder image asset (static file) at this exact path for use in the hero/header area.
Add the generated social/link icons set image asset (static file) at this exact path for use in the Links/Contact section.

Reference and render frontend/public/assets/generated/hero-banner.dim_1920x800.png and frontend/public/assets/generated/channel-avatar.dim_512x512.png in the hero with explicit sizing to prevent layout shift, and provide English alt text.

Create a Links/Contact section helper that renders additional hyperlinks and uses frontend/public/assets/generated/social-icons-set.dim_256x256.png for consistent iconography, with accessible alt text and focus states. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Wire SocialLinks into the #links section and ensure all hyperlinks are styled consistently and use the shared ExternalLink behavior.
